00002 #include <math.h>
00003 #include <stdio.h>

00005 #include "init.h"

00008 #define NOFLD (NTR+1)
00009 
00010 static double dmina1, dmina2;
00011 # define D_MIN(a,b) (dmina1=(a),dmina2=(b),((dmina1) < (dmina2)) ?\
00012                     (dmina1) : (dmina2))
00013 # define D_MAX(a,b) (dmina1=(a),dmina2=(b),((dmina1) > (dmina2)) ?\
00014                     (dmina1) : (dmina2))
00015 
00016 extern double D[NXMEM][NYMEM];       /* Basin depth, in m.            */
00017 extern double ****tr;
00018 
00019 static int num_col;               /* The number of sponge points      */
00020                                   /* within the computational domain. */
00021 static int fldno = 0;             /* The number of fields which have  */
00022                                   /* already been registered by calls */
00023                                   /* to set_up_sponge_field           */
00024 static int nf;                    /* The number of fields for which   */
00025                                   /* space has been allocated.        */
00026 static int nfNZ;                  /* nfNZ = nf * NZ.                  */
00027 static int *col_addr;             /* An array containing the addresses*/
00028                                   /* of each of the columns being     */
00029                                   /* damped in an array of horizontal */
00030                                   /* extent NXMEM by NYMEM.           */
00031 static double *Iresttime_col;     /* The inverse restoring time of    */
00032                                   /* each column.                     */
00033 static double (*var[NOFLD])[][NXMEM][NYMEM]; /* An array of pointers  */
00034                                   /* to the fields which are being    */
00035                                   /* damped.                          */
00036 static double *Ref_val;           /* The values to which the layers   */
00037                                   /* are damped.                      */
00038 
00039 
00040 void initialize_sponge(double Iresttime[NXMEM][NYMEM], int num_fields)
00041 {
00042 /* Arguments: Iresttime - The inverse of the restoring time, in s-1.  */
00043 /*  (in)      num_fields - The number of fields that will later be    */
00044 /*                         registered.                                */
00045 
00046 /* This subroutine determines the number of points which are within   */
00047 /* sponges in this computational domain.  Only points that have       */
00048 /* positive values of Iresttime and which hmask (D) indicates are ocean   */
00049 /* points are included in the sponges.  This subroutine then allocates*/
00050 /* the memory for num_fields reference profiles, to be provided later */
00051 /* by calls to set_up_sponge_field.                                   */
00052 
00053   int i, j, col = 0;
00054 
00055   nf = num_fields;
00056   nfNZ = nf*NZ;
00057   if (nf > NOFLD) {
00058     printf("Increse NOFLD to at least %d in sponge.c or decrease the\n"
00059        "number of fields to be damped in the call to initialize_sponge.\n",
00060        nf);
00061     quit(-1000);
00062   }
00063 
00064   num_col = 0;
00065   for (j=Y1;j<=ny;j++) for (i=X1;i<=nx;i++)
00066     if ((Iresttime[i][j]>0.0) && (D[i][j]>MINIMUM_DEPTH)) num_col++;
00067 
00068   if (num_col > 0) {
00069     col_addr = calloc(num_col,sizeof(int));
00070     if (col_addr == NULL) {
00071       printf("Error allocating memory for col_addr. num_col = %d.\n",
00072               num_col);
00073       quit(-1000);
00074     }
00075     Iresttime_col = calloc(num_col,sizeof(double));
00076     if (Iresttime_col == NULL) {
00077         printf("Error allocating memory for Iresttime_col. num_col = %d.\n",
00078                 num_col); 
00079         quit(-1000);
00080     }
00081     Ref_val = calloc(num_col*nfNZ,sizeof(double));
00082     if (Ref_val == NULL) {
00083       printf("Error allocating memory for Ref_val. "
00084              "num_col = %d, points per column = %d.\n", num_col,nfNZ);
00085       quit(-1000);
00086     }
00087 
00088     for (j=Y1;j<=ny;j++) for (i=X1;i<=nx;i++) {
00089       if ((Iresttime[i][j]>0.0) && (D[i][j]>MINIMUM_DEPTH)) {
00090         col_addr[col] = i*NYMEM+j;   /* j*NXMEM+i;*/
00091         Iresttime_col[col] = Iresttime[i][j];
00092         col++;
00093       }
00094     }
00095   }
00096 
00097 }
00098 
00099 void set_up_sponge_field(double sp_val[][NXMEM][NYMEM],
00100                          double (*f_ptr)[][NXMEM][NYMEM], int nlay)
00101 {
00102 /* Arguments: sp_val - The reference profiles of the quantity being   */
00103 /*                     registered.                                    */
00104 /*  (in)      f_ptr - a pointer to the field which will be damped.    */
00105 /*  (in)      nlay - the number of layers in this quantity.           */
00106 
00107 /* This subroutine stores the reference profile for the variable      */
00108 /* whose address is given by f_ptr. nlay is the number of layers in   */
00109 /* this variable.  The first call to this subroutine must be to       */
00110 /* register the interface depth profiles, and the second must be to   */
00111 /* register the mixed layer buoyancy (Rml) profiles if BULKMIXEDLAYER */
00112 /* is defined.  Subsequent calls can be made in any order.            */
00113 
00114   int i, j, k, col;
00115 
00116   if (fldno+1 > nf) {
00117     printf("Only %d fields have been allocated, as per initialize_sponge,\n"
00118            "but set_up_sponge_field has been called %d times.\n",
00119            nf, fldno+1);
00120     quit(-1000);
00121   }
00122 
00123   for (col=0;col<num_col;col++) {
00124     i = col_addr[col]/NYMEM; j = col_addr[col]-NYMEM*i;
00125     for (k=0;k<nlay;k++) Ref_val[col*nfNZ + k*nf + fldno] = sp_val[k][i][j];
00126     for (k=nlay;k<NZ;k++) Ref_val[col*nfNZ + k*nf + fldno] = 0.0;
00127   }
00128 
00129   var[fldno] = f_ptr;
00130 
00131   if (nlay!=NZ)
00132     printf("Danger:  Sponge reference fields require NZ (%d) layers.\n"
00133            "  A field with %d layers was passed to set_up_sponge_field.\n",NZ,nlay);
00134   fldno++;
00135 
00136 }
00137 
00138 void apply_sponge(double h[NZ][NXMEM][NYMEM], double dt,
00139          double ea[NZ][NXMEM][NYMEM], double eb[NZ][NXMEM][NYMEM])
00140 {
00141 /* Arguments: h -  Layer thickness, in m.                             */
00142 /*            dt - The amount of time covered by this call, in s.     */
00143 /*            ea - an array to which the amount of fluid entrained    */
00144 /*                 from the layer above during this call will be      */
00145 /*                 added, in m.                                       */
00146 /*            eb - an array to which the amount of fluid entrained    */
00147 /*                 from the layer below during this call will be      */
00148 /*                 added, in m.                                       */
00149 
00150 /* This subroutine applies damping to the layers thicknesses, mixed   */
00151 /* layer buoyancy, and a variety of tracers for every column where    */
00152 /* there is damping.                                                  */
00153 
00154   double damp;     /* The timestep times the local damping            */
00155                    /* coefficient.  Nondimensional.                   */
00156   double e[NZ+1];  /* The interface heights, in m, usually negative.  */
00157   double w;        /* The thickess of water moving upwards through an */
00158                    /* interface within 1 timestep, in m.              */
00159   double wm;       /* wm is w if w is negative and 0 otherwise, in m. */
00160   double wb;       /* w at the interface below a layer, in m.         */
00161   double wpb;      /* wpb is wb if wb is positive and 0 otherwise, m. */
00162   int c, i, j, k, m;
00163 
00164   for (c=0;c<num_col;c++) {
00165     i = col_addr[c]/NYMEM; j = col_addr[c]-NYMEM*i;
00166     damp = dt*Iresttime_col[c];
00167 
00168     e[NZ] = -D[i][j];
00169     for (k=NZ-1;k>=0;k--) e[k] = e[k+1] + h[k][i][j];
00170 
00171     wpb = 0.0; wb = 0.0;
00172     for (k=NZ-1;k>=0;k--) {
00173       w = D_MIN(((e[k] - Ref_val[c*nfNZ+k*nf+0]) * damp),
00174                 (wb+h[k][i][j] - EPSILON));
00175       wm = 0.5*(w-fabs(w));
00176       for (m=1;m<fldno;m++) {
00177         (*var[m])[k][i][j] = (h[k][i][j]*(*var[m])[k][i][j] +
00178                              Ref_val[c*nfNZ+k*nf+m] *
00179                              (damp*h[k][i][j] + wpb - wm))/
00180                    (h[k][i][j]*(1.0 + damp) + wpb - wm);
00181         tr[m-1][k][i][j] = (*var[m])[k][i][j];
00182       }
00183       wb = w; wpb = w - wm;
00184     }
00185 
00186   }
00187 }
